org.eng.aisp.storage

Class FileSoundStorage

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eng.storage.AbstractReadOnlyStorage<SoundRecording>
      • org.eng.aisp.storage.FileSoundStorage
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IDeleteableItemStorage<SoundRecording>, IFieldedItemStorage<SoundRecording>, IItemStorage<SoundRecording>, INamedItemStorage<SoundRecording>, IReadOnlyStorage<SoundRecording>

    public class FileSoundStorage
extends AbstractReadOnlyStorage<SoundRecording>
implements INamedItemStorage<SoundRecording>
    Provides file-based storage using unsegmented files in a metadata.csv file. This class is intended to be thread-safe but NOT process-safe.
    Author:
    DavidWood

        public Iterable<SoundRecording> items()
                               throws StorageException
        This returns an iterable that reads the sounds as they are iterated and defined at the time of this call. If while iterating, a sound is removed from the file system, an exception can be thrown during iteration.

      • findIDs

        public Iterable<String> findIDs(FieldValues itemFieldValues)
                         throws StorageException
        Description copied from interface: IFieldedItemStorage
        Get the ids of items with fields having values matching those in the provided map.
        Specified by:
        findIDs in interface IFieldedItemStorage<SoundRecording>
        Parameters:
        itemFieldValues - map of field names to field values. Nested fields can be specified with a '.', as in foo.bar which specifies the bar of the foo field within the stored item. If null or empty, then return all ids.
        Returns:
        never null.
        Throws:
        StorageException

      • getSoundFile

        public File getSoundFile(String id)
                  throws StorageException
        Get a file that references the underlying sound file for the given id.

        WARNING: This currently returns a reference to the file as it exists in the underlying storage implementation. As such, do not a) delete the returned file and/or b) access this instance while the file opened by the caller.

        Parameters:
        id -
        Returns:
        null if id is not associated with an existing item.
        Throws:
        StorageException

      • findItems

        public List<SoundRecording> findItems(Iterable<String> ids)
                               throws StorageException
        Implement to read all items under the ids and return as a list.
        Specified by:
        findItems in interface IReadOnlyStorage<SoundRecording>
        Overrides:
        findItems in class AbstractReadOnlyStorage<SoundRecording>
        Returns:
        a iterable of items containing the same number of items as the input id list.
        Throws:
        StorageException - if not all items could be retrieved. Note that an exception such as NoSuchElementException may be thrown while iterating the return iterable if items could not be retrieved.

      • findPagedIDs

        public Iterable<String> findPagedIDs(int pageIndex,
                                     int pageSize,
                                     FieldValues itemFieldValues)
                              throws StorageException
        Description copied from interface: IFieldedItemStorage
        Get a page of item identifiers matching the given item values..
        Specified by:
        findPagedIDs in interface IFieldedItemStorage<SoundRecording>
        Parameters:
        pageIndex - 0-based index specifying the page of ids to return.
        pageSize - maximum number of ids to return in a page. If 0, then return all ids.
        itemFieldValues - map of field names to field values. Nested fields can be specified with a '.', as in foo.bar which specifies the bar of the foo field within the stored item. If null or empty, then all items match the request.
        Returns:
        never null.
        Throws:
        StorageException
